Mar 2024 • Family

I had heard a lot about this place. So I made a visit to this ‘hill station’ in end Mar 24. I was disturbed by the levels of ecological devastation perpetrated on the place in the name of development. 

Mindless, unplanned and unaesthetic construction, which is blatantly incongruous in the setting can be seen everywhere. Umpteen road widening and bridge building projects, which must undoubtedly have been preceded by rampant tree felling of indigenous forest trees, also blight the landscape. 

The air is saturated with dust. And if one is hoping for a respite from the sweltering heat and pollution pf Visakhapatnam, then I am sorry to say, your hopes are going to be dashed.

and my wife( 61) Visited these waterfalls on the 21 November. Though my wife recently underwent total.knee replacement , still we set out for Araku and as part of it, this place. Lovely , gushing water from the rocks, nice cascading effect. The steps are not very steep. However, senior citizens( we too are) have to go slow. I climbed down all the steps ( about 100) and reached a bridge. From there,the waterfalls provide an awesome sight. results.title: Katiki Falls (2025) - All You Need to Know ... - Tripadvisor
results.content: Katika falls is one of the places which you must visit during your Vizag trip. Only jeeps take you to the Katika falls - jeep drivers drive very rashly.
